Washington 25, Do C.
15 November 1955
Dr* Frank E. Schooley
President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1U Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dr. Schooley:
With reference to your letter dated 10 November 1955, we do not have a pilot
tape prepared at this time* However, I am able to give you all the informa¬
tion, on our proposed series, available now.
Subject to your approval of our plan and pilot tape we should like to record
thirteen quarts2>hour programs on weather for release to the NAEB tape networka
We intend to record the programs as follows. We will record a series of lec¬
tures by distinguished personnel of the Air Weather Service in the classroom
at the University of Maryland. We will produce the opening and closing por»
tions of the program in our professional studios in Washington. These open¬
ings and closings will be worded to meet your specifications.
I am enclosing a brief biographical sketch of our announcer and myself (I shall
produce the series) for your perusal. I am also enclosing a list of the thir¬
teen speakers and their subjects for your consideration* I believe that they
will cover the weather field most adequately. These lectures are expected to
commence around the first of February and we can get the master tape to you
within a week following each recording. I mention this so that you may make
your plans accordingly.
If you will need more detailed information at any time, please feel free to con¬
tact me.
Sincerely,
/a/ Richard L» Spears
RICHARD L, SPEARS
2nd Lt., USAF
Chief, Radio-TV Branch
